Monday, April 30, 2007























Senate OKs Iraq bill with pullout timetable
Senators followed the lead of their defiant counterparts in the House on Thursday, passing a war-funding bill that sets a deadline for withdrawing combat forces from Iraq by next year and sets up a showdown with President Bush.
FULL STORY

•  Democrats, GOP look past Bush veto


























The Situation Room, weekdays 4 p.m. & 7 p.m. ET
Watch "The Situation Room," anchored by Wolf Blitzer, for complete, up-to-the minute coverage of the day's events. Tune in to "The Situation Room" weekdays from 4 to 6 p.m. and from 7 to 8 p.m. ET.

For a daily sneak preview of the show and an early read on the day's political news sign up for "The Situation Room" daily email newsletter at http://www.CNN.com/situationroom.






















Cheney, Reid trade barbs over Iraq
Vice President Dick Cheney accused Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid of pursuing a defeatist strategy in Iraq to win votes. Reid said that didn't warrant a response.
FULL STORY






Gonzales vows to stay on
Alberto Gonzales, with a fresh vote of confidence from President Bush, vowed to remain as attorney general despite lingering questions over the firing of prosecutors.
FULL STORY






Tenet: 'Slam dunk' comment distorted
A former U.S. spy chief accused the White House of ruining his reputation by misusing a comment he made during a meeting ahead of the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq.
FULL STORY






No blood, few jabs in first debate 
No blood was spilled in the first debate in the 2008 presidential campaign and CNN's Candy Crowley says you had to listen hard for low-impact jabs.
FULL STORY
